main.name: Jacqueline Moore
main.description: a technical writer, a photographer, and a climber.
main.bio: Hi there! I'm Jacqueline, and I'm a third-year undergraduate student at the University of California, Davis. I plan to graduate in June of 2021 with two degrees: a B.S. in biomedical engineering and a B.A. in English.
main.listIntro: I built this website because there's more to me than what's on my resume. Let's get started with a list of need-to-know facts about me:
bioList: My favorite podcast is called 'No Such Thing As A Fish.'
One of my personal goals is to climb Half Dome in Yosemite.
Another goal is to bake the perfect loaf of banana bread. (It's harder than you think.)
If you asked me what my favorite book is, I'd say Ian McEwan's 'Atonement.'
My least favorite book is 'The Catcher in the Rye.' Change my mind!
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Activities & Societies: BioInnovation Group (previously Synthetic Biology Club), Society of Women Engineers, The California Aggie (newspaper), Pre-Law Association, UC Davis Climbing Team.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern — Einstein Analytics
work.info: Salesforce is a cloud-based customer relationship management service for businesses.
work.description: Created customer-facing applet about specific features of Einstein Analytics, Salesforce's cloud-based data analysis software. The applet consists of instructional documentation, graphics, and interactive use cases built with Einstein Analytics.

work.title: Chief Content Officer
work.info: BioInnovation Group is a biotech incubator that provides undergraduate students with technological and financial resources for autonomous research projects.
work.description: Completely revamped company website by formulating a new site design, building new pages in the site, and creating written and visual content for these pages. Currently working on implementing a new, streamlined application process for all prospective researchers and team members.

work.title: Copy Editor
work.info: The California Aggie is UC Davis' official newspaper. The paper is staffed entirely by students.
work.description: Proofreading copy — roughly 25 articles per week — using The Aggie's variation of the AP Style Guide. Previously served the paper as a campus news reporter, which involved composing one article per week and conducting relevant, in-person interviews.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern
work.info: remote.it (prounced 'remote it') is a remote device management software start-up.
work.description: Wrote instructions for bulk scripts feature that were published in the company's github repository of user help documentation. Also revised technical documentation about newly-released features. Wrote copy for email campaigns about said new features.

work.company: The Arthur Morgan Institute for Community Solutions
work.title: Research Intern

projects.title: MANUAL: Guide to building tables with Einstein Analytics (not yet deployed)
COPY: remote.it email update for new feature
LAB REPORT: RFP Expression in Plasmids

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
